decision_conditions: The replacement tree must be planted on or near the existing tree by April 2025; the tree should be of a coniferous species, of either Yew (Taxus baccata) or Scots Pine (Pinus sylvestris) that is more suited to the site and of a size not less than 10-12cm girth when planted.

Reason: To ensure the continued amenity provided by the tree(s) and the planting of an appropriate species and in order to preserve the character and appearance of this part of The Croft and Park Hill street scene. | The tree work specified above must be carried out within 2 years of the date of this decision.

Reason: To ensure the work is only carried out once in respect of this consent and allow Ealing Council the opportunity to reconsider its decision in the light of prevailing circumstances, and reconsult on the case in the event of the consent expiring before implementation.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
TPO 333
T1, T2, T3 & T4 Lime trees (Tilia) - Re-pollard back to the most recent pollard points.
T5 Indian Cedar (Cedrus deodara) - Fell to stump level.

T7  Oak tree (Quercus) - Reduce the large branch that grows toward the neighbouring property by approximately 3.0m; crown reduce the west side of the canopy by no more than 2.0m in certain places to clear the building by 3.0m.
